Exceptions#

The papercutter.exceptions module defines a hierarchy of custom exceptions used throughout Papercutter.

Exception Hierarchy#

PapercutterError (exit_code=1)
├── FetchError (exit_code=10)
│   ├── PaperNotFoundError (exit_code=11)
│   ├── RateLimitError (exit_code=12)
│   └── NetworkError (exit_code=13)
├── ExtractionError (exit_code=20)
│   ├── InvalidPDFError (exit_code=21)
│   └── NoContentError (exit_code=22)
├── ConfigError (exit_code=30)
│   └── MissingAPIKeyError (exit_code=31)
└── LLMError (exit_code=40)

Base Exception#

PapercutterError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.PapercutterError[source]#

Bases: Exception

Base exception for all Papercutter errors.

Base exception for all Papercutter errors.

Attributes:

  • message (str): Error message

  • exit_code (int): CLI exit code. Default: 1

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import PapercutterError

try:
    # some operation
    pass
except PapercutterError as e:
    print(f"Error: {e}")
    sys.exit(e.exit_code)
exit_code: int = 1#
default_hint: Optional[str] = None#
__init__(message, details=None, hint=None)[source]#
Parameters:

  • message (str)

  • details (str | None)

  • hint (str | None)

Fetch Exceptions#

FetchError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.FetchError[source]#

Bases: PapercutterError

Error during paper fetching.

Base exception for paper fetching errors.

Exit Code: 10

exit_code: int = 10#

PaperNotFoundError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.PaperNotFoundError[source]#

Bases: FetchError

Paper not found at source.

Raised when a paper cannot be found at the specified source.

Exit Code: 11

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import PaperNotFoundError

raise PaperNotFoundError("arXiv paper 9999.99999 not found")
exit_code: int = 11#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'Check the ID format (e.g., 2301.00001 for arXiv, 10.1234/... for DOI)'#

RateLimitError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.RateLimitError[source]#

Bases: FetchError

Rate limited by source.

Raised when the source API rate limits the request.

Exit Code: 12

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import RateLimitError

raise RateLimitError("arXiv API rate limit exceeded. Try again in 60 seconds.")
exit_code: int = 12#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'Wait a few minutes and try again'#

NetworkError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.NetworkError[source]#

Bases: FetchError

Network connectivity issue.

Raised when a network error occurs during fetching.

Exit Code: 13

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import NetworkError

raise NetworkError("Failed to connect to arxiv.org")
exit_code: int = 13#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'Check your internet connection'#

Extraction Exceptions#

ExtractionError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.ExtractionError[source]#

Bases: PapercutterError

Error during content extraction.

Base exception for content extraction errors.

Exit Code: 20

exit_code: int = 20#

InvalidPDFError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.InvalidPDFError[source]#

Bases: ExtractionError

PDF is corrupt or unreadable.

Raised when the PDF file is invalid or corrupted.

Exit Code: 21

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import InvalidPDFError

raise InvalidPDFError("File is not a valid PDF: paper.pdf")
exit_code: int = 21#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'Ensure the file is a valid PDF document'#

NoContentError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.NoContentError[source]#

Bases: ExtractionError

No extractable content found.

Raised when no content could be extracted from the PDF.

Exit Code: 22

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import NoContentError

raise NoContentError("No text content found in paper.pdf")
exit_code: int = 22#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'The PDF may be scanned/image-only. OCR is not supported.'#

Configuration Exceptions#

ConfigError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.ConfigError[source]#

Bases: PapercutterError

Configuration error.

Base exception for configuration errors.

Exit Code: 30

exit_code: int = 30#

MissingAPIKeyError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.MissingAPIKeyError[source]#

Bases: ConfigError

Required API key not configured.

Raised when a required API key is not configured.

Exit Code: 31

Example:

from papercutter.exceptions import MissingAPIKeyError

raise MissingAPIKeyError("ANTHROPIC_API_KEY not set")
exit_code: int = 31#
default_hint: Optional[str] = 'Set PAPERCUTTER_ANTHROPIC_API_KEY or configure in ~/.papercutter/config.yaml'#

LLM Exception#

LLMError#

exception papercutter.exceptions.LLMError[source]#

Bases: PapercutterError

LLM processing error.

Exception for LLM-related errors (v0.2 feature).

Exit Code: 40

exit_code: int = 40#

Error Handling Example#

Handling exceptions in scripts:

import sys
from papercutter.exceptions import (
    PapercutterError,
    PaperNotFoundError,
    RateLimitError,
    NetworkError,
)

def fetch_paper(paper_id: str) -> None:
    try:
        # fetch logic here
        pass
    except PaperNotFoundError:
        print(f"Paper {paper_id} not found")
        sys.exit(11)
    except RateLimitError:
        print("Rate limited. Please wait and try again.")
        sys.exit(12)
    except NetworkError as e:
        print(f"Network error: {e}")
        sys.exit(13)
    except PapercutterError as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")
        sys.exit(e.exit_code)

CLI Error Handling#

The CLI automatically handles exceptions and returns appropriate exit codes:

# Check exit code after command
papercutter fetch arxiv invalid_id
echo $?  # Returns 11 (PaperNotFoundError)

# Use in scripts
if ! papercutter fetch arxiv 2301.00001 -o ./papers; then
    echo "Failed to fetch paper"
fi
